_comment: Add a _ before an option name to comment it out and it wont be added to the apworld
Using 'goal' as the name of an option let you override some of the generated goal parameters
_goal.description: How to End your Randomized playthrough.

_filler_traps._comment: Using values here let you set a 'recommended' filler_trap percentage or even a default percentage

description: This is a Toggle
A simple boolean, aka True or False set the initial value with "default"
This is a Choice
Let the user pick from a list of values
allow_custom_value let a player define their own text value
Currently the only use for Choice in Manual outside of hooks is the goal
This is a Range
Allow the player to specify a value between 'start' and 'end'
if you include a "values" you can define the label for certain values
Currently the only use for Range in Manual outside of hooks is 'filler_trap'
TIf you are reading this you are using an all inclusive yaml file.
Some options contained in this file may or may not apply depending on what game you are playing, as selected in 'CTR Game' below.
Options that do not apply to a certain game should be clearly marked as such in their description.
(This toggle does nothing other than to put text here.)
This option tells generation what game you are playing.
Classic CTR: This is the PS1 version of Crash Team Racing. Some options are not available with this option selected.
CTR NF: This is Crash Team Racing: Nitro Fueled.
This option determines f there is a final challenge after collecting the number of trophies.
Trophy Hunt sets collecting the trophies to be the goal.
Final Challenge still has you collect trophies, but after gathering the necessary amount, a random track
or cup (if enabled) will be selected as a final challenge to beat.
At this time, enabling this option forces cups_unlock_method to use Cup Items.

percentage_trophies.display_name: What percentage of trophies to collect?
description: Select what percentage (1-100) of trophies are needed to achieve the goal or unlock the final challenge.
100 means all available trophies are required.

starting_locations.display_name: Select the number of starting maps.
description: Select the number (1-3) of starting maps.
This option controls what CPU difficulties are included in the randomizer.
Each difficulty adds three checks per single race and cup.
Each difficulty adds up to five checks per arena.
Choose whether to include Single Race mode.
At least one game mode must be included to generate.
Choose whether to include Cup Race mode.
At least one game mode must be included to generate.
Choose whether to include Time Trial mode.
Presently, this mode also requires Single Race Mode to be included or generation will fail.
CTR:NF only.
Choose whether to include Battle mode.
At least one game mode must be included to generate.
CTR:NF only.
This option controls which tracks and cups are included in the randomizer.
Classic adds 18 tracks
Nitro adds 13 tracks
Bonus adds 8 tracks
If Single Race mode or Cups is not enabled, this option will be ignored.
Choose whether to include Turbo Track in Single Race arcade mode.
To unlock Turbo Track in Classic CTR, you can enter the following code at the main menu:
Hold L1+R1 and Press Right (x2), Left, Triangle, Right, Down (x2)
Turbo Track is already unlocked by default in CTR:NF.
Choose the method for unlocking cups.
Four Tracks uses the four tracks included in each cup to unlock it. Having access to all four tracks unlocks access to the corresponding cup.
Cup Items adds a cup item to the pool for each cup that unlocks that cup. Having the cup item unlocks the cup regardless of if you have access to its four tracks.
If cups are not enabled, this option will be ignored.
If single race mode is not enabled, Cup Items will be selected and this option will be ignored.
Choose whether to include Time Trial ghosts in the locations pool.
Each ghost will also include the ghosts before it.
If time trial mode is not enabled, this option will be ignored.
Only N. Tropy and N. Oxide are available in Classic CTR.

Characters or Driving Styles are added into the item pool as filler. Depending on other settings, not all randomized characters may be available in a given seed.
None: All characters are playable as the player chooses.
Driving Styles: All characters are playable as the player chooses, but the five driving styles are added to the pool and can only be used once found.
This option not available in Classic CTR.
Starter: The starter characters are randomized. Unlockable characters and characters from the pit stop are not playable in this option.
Unlockable: Starter and Unlockable characters are randomized. Characters from the Pit Stop are not playable in this option. (CTR:NF only.)
All Characters: All characters are randomized.
If randomizing characters, the player may decide to use the character's default driving style or one of their chosing.
CTR:NF only.
